newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks close-up for fifth straight session.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks close-up for fifth straight session.

text.p: Caracas stocks closed ahead for the fifth straight session with strong demand for blue chips focused on leading utility Electricidad de Caracas and textile company Sudamtex, brokers said.
Electricidad, which closed up 3.50 bolivars at 528.50, has risen in recent sessions on reports the government may soon increase its tariffs by as much as 78 percent.
"As for Sudamtex B shares, investors are riding the news that George Soros has bought a stake in the company," said Financorp broker Miguel Ortiz.

The stock exchange circulated a note to brokers midday Monday that a group of funds controlled by New York-based financial guru George Soros had bought a 20 percent stake in the company with the purchase of 3.45 million American Depositary Receipts, equivalant to 138 million underlying Class B shares.
The share closed off 1.00 bolivar at 39.75 as nearly eight million shares exchanged hands.
The bolsa's 19-share index rose 0.21 percent to end at 6,326.10 as 26 million shares traded, worth 3.2 billion bolivars ($6.7 million).
Merinvest's composite index, which contains telephone company CANTV, rose 0.72 percent to 97.36 points.
Among traded stocks, 18 rose, 12 fell and five closed flat.
